list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Added Readme
- fixed formatting issue on TaskService - updated UML by removing User class

task.summary:
Major: - implemented working client-server functionality - client-server sends/receives task list obj - client-server sends/receives task objs - user is able to make multiple server requests within the same session - implemented getTaskList within TaskManager - implemented updateTask, addTask, and deleteTask
Minor: - refactored getTaskList to use HashMap instead of ArrayList for easier retrieval of tasks by key - removed id member variable and getId method from Content - added Serializable interface to Content so that we can pass objs through the server

Minor changes and 1 bug fix - changed getTaskList call on Server to print titles and reset the object buffer - removed toString methods in Task and TaskPreview - removed some code used to troubleshoot failed object transfer between client and server - fixed bug where Task objects weren't sent to client

Added toString methods in enum, for improved FXML text display
Example Usage: Status status //holds Status enum type String statusString status.toString() //converts enum to string

Big changes are adding client/server functionality for getting and deleting tasks. Also fixed this annoying bug with duplicate tasks appearing in the taskList. Some other small changes, and I updated the UML design as well.
- added methods in client/server for getTask, deleteTask - fixed issue in TaskPreview constructor where variables weren't being assigned using Task getters - fixed bug in getTaskList where duplicate tasks were added to the list - adjusted deleteTask in TaskManager for more clear return call when task is deleted - added getTask functionality to client/server - added deleteTask functionality to client/server - deleted some test code in Main - clean up print statements used for testing in client and server

Finalized client-server code and refactored client so it can be called as a variable in TaskController
- added socket details to client constructor - finished updateTask method - refactored client methods to avoid returning null in event of error - made client methods thread-safe by adding synchronized - added a bunch of test code to Main, it can be deleted or adjusted as needed - added Builder class to uml diagram
Adding Jesse's TaskController work to my pull request

Added Readme
- fixed formatting issue on TaskService - updated UML by removing User class

MESSAGE.value:
Major: - implemented working client-server functionality - client-server sends/receives task list obj - client-server sends/receives task objs - user is able to make multiple server requests within the same session - implemented getTaskList within TaskManager - implemented updateTask, addTask, and deleteTask
Minor: - refactored getTaskList to use HashMap instead of ArrayList for easier retrieval of tasks by key - removed id member variable and getId method from Content - added Serializable interface to Content so that we can pass objs through the server

Minor changes and 1 bug fix - changed getTaskList call on Server to print titles and reset the object buffer - removed toString methods in Task and TaskPreview - removed some code used to troubleshoot failed object transfer between client and server - fixed bug where Task objects weren't sent to client

Added toString methods in enum, for improved FXML text display
Example Usage: Status status //holds Status enum type String statusString status.toString() //converts enum to string

Big changes are adding client/server functionality for getting and deleting tasks. Also fixed this annoying bug with duplicate tasks appearing in the taskList. Some other small changes, and I updated the UML design as well.
- added methods in client/server for getTask, deleteTask - fixed issue in TaskPreview constructor where variables weren't being assigned using Task getters - fixed bug in getTaskList where duplicate tasks were added to the list - adjusted deleteTask in TaskManager for more clear return call when task is deleted - added getTask functionality to client/server - added deleteTask functionality to client/server - deleted some test code in Main - clean up print statements used for testing in client and server

Finalized client-server code and refactored client so it can be called as a variable in TaskController
- added socket details to client constructor - finished updateTask method - refactored client methods to avoid returning null in event of error - made client methods thread-safe by adding synchronized - added a bunch of test code to Main, it can be deleted or adjusted as needed - added Builder class to uml diagram
Adding Jesse's TaskController work to my pull request

Added Readme
- fixed formatting issue on TaskService - updated UML by removing User class
